VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (02) Understanding Azure Virtual Machines
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Get conceptual background information about IaaS, VMs, available features, product variations, costs, and more.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (03) How Do I: Create and Connect to a Virtual Machine
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Watch Bob create a VM and connect to its desktop via the Remote Desktop Connection utility.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (04) How Do I: Configure Network Endpoints
Author: JeffKoch
Description: See how to configure network endpoints to allow communication with the new VM through other network ports, like HTTP or FTP. Plus, learn how to connect a local copy of SQL Server Management Studio to

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (05) How Do I: Attach Disks to a Virtual Machine
Author: JeffKoch
Description: See a demo on how to add new virtual hard drives (VHDs) to a VM from the Azure Portal.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (06) How Do I: Format Disks in a Virtual Machine
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Following on the heels of the previous module, watch Bob take the demo one more step as he initializes and formats the new VHDs.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (07) How Do I: Create an Image from a Virtual Machine
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Explore configuring a VM and using it as a template from which new VMs can be provisioned. Find out what you really get when you create an image and a new VM from that image.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (08) How Do I: Configure an Availability Set to Scale VMs
Author: JeffKoch
Description: In the spirit of scaling out rather than scaling up, see how to create an Availability set and then allow VMs to join it.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (09) Understanding Load Balancing in Azure
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Examine the Load Balancer, how traffic is load balanced at the network level, the function of the Internal Load Balancer, and more.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (10) How Do I: Configure a Load Balanced Set of Virtual Machines
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Take a look at setting up Load Balanced Sets, and see how they work. Although Availability Sets focus on resiliency, Load Balanced Sets focus on performance.

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (11) Understanding Virtual IP and Reserved IP Addresses
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Explore Virtual (public), Private, Reserved, and Static IP addresses. When provisioning new VMs, two IP addresses are assigned to the VM; however, these IP addresses are not bound to the subscription

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (12) Understanding the Relationship Between Cloud Services and VMs
Author: JeffKoch
Description: Although we've avoided talking about Cloud Services in this series of courses, we could not avoid it forever! Get more of the full story about VMs, as we look at their relationship with Cloud Services

VideoTitle: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals: Virtual Machines: (13) How Do I: Configure Two VMs in the Same Cloud Service to Communicate
Author: JeffKoch
Description: In the previous module, we talked about adding two more more VMs into the same Cloud Service and we saw that those VMs had network access to each other. In this module, see how to set that up.
